)

Constructor.

Parameters:
editorThe video editor reference
mediaItemIdThe MediaItem id
filenameThe image file name
renderingModeThe rendering mode
beginMsStart time in milliseconds. Set to 0 to extract from the beginning
endMsEnd time in milliseconds. Set to END_OF_FILE to extract until the end
volumePercentin %/. 100% means no change; 50% means half value, 200% means double, 0% means silent.
mutedtrue if the audio is muted
audioWaveformFilenameThe name of the audio waveform file

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::addEffect ( const Effect &  effect)

Add the specified effect to this media item.

Note that certain types of effects cannot be applied to video and to image media items. For example in certain implementation a Ken Burns implementation cannot be applied to video media item.

This method invalidates transition video clips if the effect overlaps with the beginning and/or the end transition.

Parameters:
effectThe effect to apply

Reimplemented from gaia::media::MediaItem.

void gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::extractAudioWaveform ( const ExtractAudioWaveformProgressListener &  listener)

This API allows to generate a file containing the sample volume levels of the Audio track of this media item.

This function may take significant time and is blocking. The file can be retrieved using getAudioWaveformFilename().

Parameters:
listenerThe progress listener
int32_t gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::getAspectRatio ( ) [virtual]

Get aspect ratio of the source media item.

Returns:
the aspect ratio as described in MediaProperties. MediaProperties.ASPECT_RATIO_UNDEFINED if aspect ratio is not supported as in MediaProperties

base::String gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::getAudioWaveformFilename ( )

Get the audio waveform file name if extractAudioWaveform() was successful.

The file format is as following:

  • first 4 bytes provide the number of samples for each value, as big-endian signed
  • 4 following bytes is the total number of values in the file, as big-endian signed
  • all values follow as bytes Name is unique.
Returns:
the name of the file, null if the file has not been computed or if there is no Audio track in the mediaItem

int64_t  newDurationMs 
) [virtual]

Invalidate the start and end transitions if necessary.

This method is typically called when the start time and/or duration of an overlay or effect is changing.

Parameters:
oldStartTimeMsThe old start time of the effect or overlay
oldDurationMsThe old duration of the effect or overlay
newStartTimeMsThe new start time of the effect or overlay

bool gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::isMuted ( )

MediaVideoItem& gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::operator= ( const MediaVideoItem &  other)
int64_t gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::renderFrame ( const core::SurfaceHolder &  surfaceHolder,
int64_t  timeMs 
)

Render a frame according to the playback (in the native aspect ratio) for the specified media item.

All effects and overlays applied to the media item are ignored. The extract boundaries are also ignored. This method can be used to playback frames when implementing trimming functionality.

Parameters:
surfaceHolderSurfaceHolder used by the application
timeMstime corresponding to the frame to display (relative to the the beginning of the media item).
Returns:
The accurate time stamp of the frame that is rendered .
void gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::setExtractBoundaries ( int64_t  beginMs,
int64_t  endMs 
)

Sets the start and end marks for trimming a video media item.

This method will adjust the duration of bounding transitions, effects and overlays if the current duration of the transactions become greater than the maximum allowable duration.

Parameters:
beginMsStart time in milliseconds. Set to 0 to extract from the beginning
endMsEnd time in milliseconds. Set to END_OF_FILE to extract until the end
void gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::setMute ( bool  muted)
Parameters:
mutedtrue to mute the media item
void gaia::media::MediaVideoItem::setVolume ( int32_t  volumePercent)

Set volume of the Audio track of this mediaItem.

Parameters:
volumePercentin %/. 100% means no change; 50% means half value, 200% means double, 0% means silent.
